definition: the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
clothes/CL:件[jian4]/Kangxi radical 145
to dress/to wear/to put on (clothes)
variant of 缽|钵[bo1]
small earthenware plate or basin/a monk's alms bowl/Sanskrit paatra
to take up sb's mantle/to follow in sb's steps

sentences.english: The little bonzer became the master's inheritor later.
sentences.chinese: 后来，这位小和尚成了师傅的衣钵传人。

sentences.english: I'd have been very happy to inherit his shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我会很高兴继承他的衣钵的。

sentences.english: Facts and Truth are no longer the mantle.
sentences.chinese: 事实和真理不再是可继承的衣钵。

sentences.english: Maybe as Pelé put it that I'm going to step in his shoes, that one did not happen.
sentences.chinese: 可能贝利说我能继承他的衣钵，这件事我没做到。

sentences.english: This year’s fourteen graduates kept the flag flying.
sentences.chinese: 今年的十四名毕业生传承了衣钵。

sentences.english: College graduate, will inherit his fathers mantle when a MingXin thoracic surgery doctor.
sentences.chinese: 学院毕业，将继承父亲的衣钵当一名心胸外科医生。

sentences.english: She inherited the mantle of Ma Hong Tai Chi, Tai Chi and become a great master.
sentences.chinese: 她继承了马虹太极拳之衣钵，而成为太极一代宗师。

sentences.english: A well-known British science writer (and former Economist journalist), Mr Ridley has taken on the mantle of rational optimism from the late Mr Simon.
sentences.chinese: 他从已故的西蒙先生那儿接过理性乐观主义的衣钵。

sentences.english: Your essence remains the Nazi mantle, you are still wear new shoes to follow the beaten track.
sentences.chinese: 你的骨子里仍然是纳粹的衣钵，你还在穿新鞋走老路。
